item.title: Why am I getting compiling errors?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

I’m trying to write logs to a specified folder on my Desktop.

[code]
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(
new FileWriter(
"W:\Users\BreeBreeBRAN\Desktop\Text Docs

\banlogs.txt",
true));
bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) {
try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error logging bans!”);
}
}[/code]

But my compiler returns

client.java:12991: error: illegal escape character
“W:\Users\BreeBreeBRAN\Desktop\Text Docs\banlogs
.txt”,

Read full topic
item.source: Why am I getting compiling errors?
